tuv.seg: • Who is liable to pay?
• Cé atá faoi dhliteanas íoc?
Domestic water charges were introduced in 2015 for homes that are connected to a public water supply or to public wastewater services
Tugadh córas nua muirir uisce tí isteach i 2015 do thithe atá nasctha le soláthar uisce poiblí nó le seirbhísí fuíolluisce poiblí
Irish Water, the national water utility, administers the water charges
Riarann Uisce Éireann, an t-údarás náisiúnta seirbhísí uisce, na muirir
Suspension of water charges
Muirir uisce a chur ar fionraí
The Water Services (Amendment) Act 2016 became law in July 2016
I mí Iúil 2016, chuir an tAcht um Sheirbhísí Uisce (Leasú) 2016 na muirir uisce tí ar fionraí ó 1 Iúil 2016 go 31 Márta 2017. Faoin Acht seo:
It also suspended domestic water charges for 9 months, from 1 July 2016 to 31 March 2017, with no charging or billing of domestic customers during that period
• tá an muirear uisce tí curtha ar fionraí ar feadh 9 mí, ó 1 Iúil 2016 go 31 Márta 2017
This suspension has been extended for a further 4 months by the Water Services Act (Extension of Suspension of Domestic Water Charges) Order 2017
Ní ghearrfar muirear ar chustaiméirí tí ná ní chuirfear bille chucu le linn na tréimhse sin

An expert commission was established to make recommendations on a sustainable long-term funding model for domestic water and wastewater services. The commission’s report (pdf) was published in November 2016
• tá eisiúint billí uisce tí curtha ar fionraí le haghaidh an dara ráithe in 2016, billí a bhí le heisiúint sa tríú ráithe in 2016
An Oireachtas committee then considered the commission’s recommendations and developed its own recommendations, which were published on 12 April 2017
Bunaíodh sainchoimisiún chun moltaí a dhéanamh maidir le múnla inbhuanaithe fadtréimhseach maoinithe le haghaidh uisce tí agus seirbhísí dramhuisce
You can read the committee’s report (pdf) on oireachtas.ie
Déanfaidh Coiste Oireachtais na moltaí sin a mheas agus a moltaí féin a fhorbairt
There is a set of FAQs (pdf) about the report on housing.gov.ie
Táthar ag súil go vótálfaidh an tOireachtas ar mholtaí an choiste faoi dheireadh mhí an Mhárta 2017
The Oireachtas will now vote on the committee’s recommendations, which include:

D’fhéadfadh sé tarlú go sínfí an tréimhse fhionraíochta 9 mí má bhíonn tuilleadh ama á iarraidh ag an gcoiste Oireachtais chun a chuid oibre a chur i gcrích nó má bhíonn tuilleadh ama ag teastáil ón Rialtas chun moltaí choiste an Oireachtais a mheas
• An overall review of the strategy based on this report should take place after 5 years
Tá An Deontas Caomhnaithe Uisce curtha ar fionraí le haghaidh 2016
• A referendum should be held on the issue of water services continuing in public ownership
Ní ghlacfar le hiarratas ar bith eile le haghaidh Dheontas Caomhnaithe Uisce 2015
Legislation and previous changes
Reachtaíocht agus athruithe eile
The system of domestic water charges was introduced under the Water Services (No
Tugadh an córas nua isteach faoin Acht um Sheirbhísí Uisce (Uimh
Related legislation is published on housing.gov.ie
Tá reachtaíocht ghaolmhar foilsithe ar housing.gov.ie
The Water Services Act 2014 brought in several revisions to the system, including caps on annual charges, a Water Conservation Grant of €100 per year and a statutory dispute resolution system

Thug an tAcht um Sheirbhísí Uisce, 2014 roinnt leasuithe isteach ar an gcóras, lena n-áirítear teorainneacha ar mhuirir bhliantúla; Deontas Caomhantais Uisce €100 sa bhliain (atá stadta anois) agus córas reachtúil chun díospóidí a réiteach
You can read the key elements of these revisions (pdf) and a set of detailed FAQs (pdf)
Faigh tuilleadh eolais faoi phríomhghnéithe na n-athbhreithnithe thuas (pdf) agus léigh sraith cheisteanna coitianta mionsonraithe amach (pdf)
Homeowners are legally responsible for water pipes and systems inside their dwelling and between the dwelling and the property boundary
Tá úinéirí tí freagrach go dlíthiúil, áfach, as píobáin agus córais uisce atá taobh istigh dá n-áit chónaithe agus idir an áit chónaithe agus teorainn na réadmhaoine
This means that you would normally need to pay a plumber to fix a leak, whether it is inside your home or on the external supply pipe between your home and the property boundary
Ciallaíonn seo gur gnách go mbeadh ort pluiméir a íoc chun sceitheadh a dheisiú
You can use Irish Water’s checklist to see if you have any internal leaks
Is féidir seicliosta Uisce Éireann a úsáid chun féachaint an bhfuil sceitheadh inmheánach uisce agat
Under the First Fix Free Scheme, Irish Water will contact you by post if your water meter indicates that there may be a leak on your external supply pipe

Faoin Scéim um an Chéad Deisiú Saor in Aisce, rachaidh Uisce Éireann i dteagmháil leat tríd an bpost má léiríonn do mhéadar uisce go bhfuil seans ann go bhfuil sceitheadh i do phíobán seachtrach soláthair
If you are eligible for the scheme (see below) Irish Water will offer you a free investigation on this pipe and free repair of identified leaks
Má tá tú i dteideal na scéime (féach thíos) déanfaidh Uisce Éireann fiosrú saor in aisce ar an bpíobán seo chomh maith le sceitheadh ar bith a aimsítear a dheisiú saor in aisce
Generally, this will involve fully replacing the pipe from the meter to a point as close to the dwelling as possible
De ghnáth, is éard a bhíonn i gceist leis seo ná píobán iomlán nua a chur isteach ón méadar go dtí pointe a ghaire don áit chónaithe agus is féidir

The First Fix Free Scheme is available to domestic customers who have registered with Irish Water; who have water meters; whose property has a working and accessible inside stop valve; and whose water meter indicates a leak on the external supply pipe

Tá an Scéim um an Chéad Deisiú Saor in Aisce ar fáil do chustaiméirí tí atá tar éis clárú le hUisce Éireann; a bhfuil méadair uisce acu; a bhfuil comhla stoptha infheidhme agus inrochtana ina n-ait chónaithe acu; agus a léiríonn a méadar uisce go bhfuil sceitheadh sa phíobán seachtrach soláthair acu
Who is liable to pay?
Cé atá faoi dhliteanas íoc?
Domestic water charges have been suspended – see ‘Suspension of water charges’ above
Tá na muirir uisce tí curtha ar fionraí - féach 'Muirir uisce a chur ar fionraí' thuas
The occupier of the property that gets water and/or wastewater services from Irish Water is liable to pay domestic water charges
Tá áititheoir na réadmhaoine a fhaigheann seirbhísí uisce agus/nó fuíolluisce ó Uisce Éireann faoi dhliteanas muirir uisce tí a íoc
If you own a property, you are presumed to be the occupier, unless it is proven otherwise
Má tá réadmhaoin agat, glacfar leis gur tusa an t-áititheoir, mura gcruthaítear a mhalairt
The tenant of a property is the occupier and is responsible for paying the water charges
Is é tionónta réadmhaoine an t-áititheora agus tá sé/sí freagrach as na muirir uisce a íoc

Since 1 October 2015, property owners have to provide information to Irish Water on the occupiers of the property within 20 days of the start of a tenancy and there is to be a deemed obligation, in all new tenancy agreements except for short-term lets, for the occupier or tenant to pay water charges
Féadfaidh tiarnaí talún ainmneacha a dtionóntaí a sholáthar lena chruthú nach iad an t-áititheoir, agus déanfaidh Uisce Éireann teagmháil leis na tionóntaí
If there are no tenants in the property, the minimum 'not permanently occupied' charge applies – see ‘Rates’ below
Mura bhfuil aon tionóntaí sa réadmhaoin, baineann an muirear íosta ‘gan áitiú buan’ – féach ‘Rátaí’ thíos
Types of water/wastewater system
Saghsanna de chóras uisce/fuíolluisce

If your water comes from a private well or a group water scheme and you have a private wastewater treatment system (such as a septic tank) you are not regarded as a customer of Irish Water and do not have to pay domestic water charges

Má thagann d’uisce ó thobar príobháideach nó ó ghrúpscéim uisce agus má tá córas cóireála príobháideach fuíolluisce agat (ar nós umar seipteach), ní chaithfear leat mar chustaiméir Uisce Éireann agus ní bheidh ort na muirir uisce tí a íoc
This table shows which types of system are and are not subject to domestic water charges:
Léirítear sa tábla a leanas cén saghsanna córais atá agus nach bhfuil faoi réir na muirear uisce tí:
│Water supplier │Wastewater │Customer of Irish Water?
│Soláthróir uisce │Fuíolluisce │Custaiméir Uisce Éireann?
│Public mains │Public sewer │Yes │
│Príomhphíobán poiblí │Séarach poiblí │Is ea │
│Public mains │Own treatment (septic tank or wastewater treatment system) │Yes (for a single service) │
│Príomhphíobán poiblí │Féinchóireáil (umar seipteach nó córas cóireála fuíolluisce) │Is ea (do sheirbhís singil) │
│Group water scheme │Public sewer │Yes (for a single service) │
│Grúpscéim uisce │Séarach poiblí │Is ea (do sheirbhís singil) │
│Group water scheme │Own treatment │No │
│Grúpscéim uisce │Féinchóireáil │Ní hea │
│Private well │Public sewer │Yes (for a single service) │
│Tobar príobháideach │Séarach poiblí │Is ea (do sheirbhís singil) │
│Private well │Own treatment │No │
│Tobar príobháideach │Féinchóireáil │Ní hea │
Domestic water charges have been suspended – see ‘Suspension of water charges’ above
Tá na muirir uisce tí curtha ar fionraí - féach 'Muirir uisce a chur ar fionraí' thuas
Irish Water continues to install water meters
Tá méadair uisce á suiteáil ag Uisce Éireann
Your meter measures the amount of water supplied to your home
Déanfaidh do mhéadar an méid uisce a sholáthraítear do do theach a thomhais
The amount of wastewater discharged is assumed to be the same as the amount of water drawn from the supply
Meastar gurb ionann an méid fuíolluisce a scaoiltear ón réadmhaoin agus an méid céanna uisce a tarraingíodh ón soláthar

While the meter measures your water usage, your quarterly bill is capped at a maximum rate for your household type, so you do not have to pay any more than this maximum capped rate – see ‘Rates’ below

Cé go ndéanfaidh an méadar d’úsáid uisce a thomhais, cuirfear teorainn ráta uasta ar do bhille ráithiúil i dtaobh shaghas do theaghlaigh, mar sin, ní bheidh ort níos mó a íoc ná an ráta teoranta seo – féach ‘Rátaí’ thíos
The capped charges will apply until 31 December 2018
Beidh na muirir theoranta i bhfeidhm go dtí an 31 Nollaig 2018
The Water Services Act 2014 provides for the capping of charges beyond 2018, subject to a Ministerial Order being approved by both Houses of the Oireachtas
Foráiltear san Acht um Sheirbhísí Uisce, 2014 do theorainn a chur ar mhuirir i ndiaidh 2018, faoi réir go bhfaomhann an dá Theach den Oireachtas Ordú ón Aire
If you need to use extra water because of a medical condition, you do not have to provide any extra information, as your bills are capped in the same way as for everyone else

Más gá duit breis uisce a úsáid mar gheall ar riocht leighis, ní bheidh ort aon fhaisnéis bhreise a sholáthar, mar gheall go gcuirtear teorainn ar do bhillí ar an mbealach céanna a dhéantar i gcás gach duine eile
(However, you can apply to be registered for priority services if you are critically dependent on water.)
(Féadfaidh tú iarratas a dhéanamh, áfach, go gclárófar thú le haghaidh seirbhísí tosaíochta má bhraitheann tú go criticiúil ar uisce.)
Rebates, allowances and discounts
Aisíocaíochtaí, liúntais agus lascainí
If your metered usage is lower than the capped charge level, your bill will be less than the capped rate
Má tá d’úsáid mhéadraithe níos ísle ná leibhéal an mhuirir theoranta, beidh do bhille níos lú ná an ráta teoranta

If you do not yet have a water meter, your bill will be fixed at the relevant capped rate, but after your meter has been installed, you will get a rebate if your metered usage over a 1-year period turns out to be lower than the capped level

Mura bhfuil méadar uisce agat go fóill, socrófar do bhille ar an ráta ábhartha teoranta, ach i ndiaidh gur suiteáladh do mhéadar, gheobhaidh tú aisíocaíocht má tharlaíonn go mbíonn d’úsáid mhéadraithe thar thréimhse bhliain amháin ná an leibhéal teoranta
Metered bills provide for a free allowance to cover each child’s normal water/wastewater needs (21,000 litres per child), regardless of entitlement to Child Benefit
Soláthríonn billí méadraithe liúntas saor in aisce chun íoc as gnáthriachtanais uisce/fuíolluisce gach linbh (21,000 lítear in aghaidh an linbh) gan aird ar theidlíocht do Shochar Linbh

If your water quality is not what it should be and there is a Boil Notice or Drinking Water Restriction Notice in effect, you will get a 100% discount on the water supply element of your charge until the notice is lifted

Murab ionann do cháilíocht uisce agus an cháilíocht ar cheart di a bhaint amach agus má tá Fógra Beirithe nó Fógra um Chosc ar Uisce Óil i bhfeidhm, gheobhaidh tú lascaine 100% ar ghné sholáthair uisce do mhuirir go dtí go mbaintear an fógra
Registering with Irish Water
Clárú le hUisce Éireann

Irish Water has sent application packs to every house in the State, asking people to indicate which (if any) public water services they have, and to confirm their household details – see ‘How to apply’ below. All households have been asked to register
Táthar ag iarraidh ar gach teaghlach clárú – fiú mura n-úsáideann tú aon seirbhísí uisce poiblí, beidh ort clárú go mbeidh tú i dteideal an Deontas Caomhantais Uisce a fháil
The requirement to provide Personal Public Service Numbers (PPS Numbers) when registering with Irish Water is no longer in effect
Níl an riachtanas chun Uimhreacha Pearsanta Seirbhíse Poiblí (UPSPanna) a sholáthar nuair a bhíonn clárú á dhéanamh agat le hUisce Éireann i bhfeidhm a thuilleadh
Irish Water has developed a protocol, in consultation with the Data Protection Commissioner, for deleting all the PPS Numbers that it had collected
D’fhorbair Uisce Éireann prótacal, i gcomhairliúchán leis an gCoimisinéir Cosanta Sonraí, chun gach UPSP a bhailigh siad a scrios
If you do not register with Irish Water, you will be charged a default rate of €260 a year up to 31 December 2018
Mura gcláraíonn tú le hUisce Éireann, gearrfar ráta mainneachtana €260 sa bhliain a fhad leis an 31 Nollaig 2018
• If you registered during 2015, your occupancy details and any allowances will be backdated to 1 January 2015
• Má chláraigh tú i rith 2015, siardhátófar do shonraí áitíochta agus aon liúntais go dtí an 1 Eanáir 2015
• If you register during 2016, your occupancy details and any allowances will be backdated for the billing period in which you register, and the billing period before it
• Má chláraíonn tú i rith 2016, siardhátófar do shonraí áitíochta agus aon liúntais don tréimhse bhilleála ina gcláraíonn tú, agus an tréimhse bhilleála roimhe sin
Irish Water’s First Fix Free Scheme (described above) is only available to registered customers
Níl scéim an Chéid Deisithe de chuid Uisce Éireann (ar a ndéantar cur síos thuas) ar fáil ach do chustaiméirí a chláraigh
Domestic water charges have been suspended – see ‘Suspension of water charges’ above
Tá na muirir uisce tí curtha ar fionraí - féach 'Muirir uisce a chur ar fionraí' thuas
Domestic water bills are issued 4 times a year
Eisítear billí uisce 4 huaire sa bhliain
The first bills issued from April 2015, in respect of the quarter January-March 2015
Eisíodh na chéad bhillí ó Aibreán 2015 ar aghaidh, maidir leis an ráithe ó Eanáir go Márta 2015
You can opt for paper or paperless billing
Féadfaidh tú billeáil ar pháipéar nó gan pháipéar a roghnú

Irish Water has developed a confidential special services register for customers who need billing or other customer services adapted to suit their needs and you can choose to get your bill in a range of accessible formats

D’fhorbair Uisce Éireann clár rúnda seirbhísí speisialta do chustaiméirí a dteastaíonn uathu go gcuirtear billeáil nó seirbhísí eile do chustaiméirí in oiriúint dá riachtanais agus féadfaidh tú a roghnú chun do bhille a fháil i réimse d’fhormáidí inrochtana
There are several payment options, including direct debit; electronic funds transfer; full or partial payment (of at least €5) at post offices and retail outlets
Tá roinnt roghanna íocaíochta ann do bhillí uisce, lena n-áirítear dochar díreach; ríomhaistriú airgid, íocaíocht iomlán nó pháirteach (€5 ar a laghad) ag oifigí an phoist agus ag asraonta miondíola
If you are getting a social welfare payment through the post office, you can use the Household Budget Scheme to pay regular weekly amounts (of at least €2.50) off your water bills

Má tá íocaíocht leasa shóisialaigh á fáil agat trí oifig an phoist, is féidir úsáid a bhaint as an Scéim Bhuiséadta Teaghlaigh chun méideanna rialta seachtainiúla a íoc (€2.50 ar a laghad) i dtreo do bhillí uisce
If you are in financial difficulty, the Money Advice and Budgeting Service (MABS) can help with budgeting in general
Má tá deacrachtaí airgeadais agat, féadfaidh an tSeirbhís Bhuiséadta agus Chomhairle Airgid (SBCA) cabhrú leat le buiséadú ginearálta a dhéanamh
The Exceptional Needs Payment is available to people who have severe financial difficulties
Tá fáil ar an Íocaíocht ar Riachtanais Eisceachtúla ag daoine atá thíos le deacrachtaí móra airgeadais
Irish Water has outlined its approach to customers who have payment difficulties
Thug Uisce Éireann cuntas ar a gcur chuige maidir le custaiméirí a bhfuil deacrachtaí íocaíochta acu
This includes developing payment plans and engaging with relevant agencies, such as MABS, with the customer’s permission
Áirítear leis seo pleananna íocaíochta a fhorbairt agus teagmháil a dhéanamh leis na gníomhaireachtaí ábhartha, ar nós an SBCA, tar éis cead a fháil ón gcustaiméir
Read more in Irish Water’s Domestic Billing Code of Practice (pdf) and in the Billing explained section of its website
Is féidir leat níos mó a léamh faoi seo i gCód Cleachtais um Billeáil Teaghlaigh (pdf) Uisce Éireann agus sa leathanach Billing Explained
If you don’t pay your bills
Mura n-íocann tú do bhillí
Irish Water will not cut you off or reduce your water supply, but late payment charges will accrue on your account – see ‘Rates’ below
Ní ghearrfaidh ná ní laghdóidh Uisce Éireann do sholáthar uisce, ach fabhrófar muirir ar íocaíocht dhéanach ar do chuntas – féach ‘Rátaí’ thíos
Irish Water can also take people to court if they don’t pay their bills
Ina theannta sin, féadfaidh Uisce Éireann daoine a thabhairt chun na cúirte mura n-íocann siad a gcuid billí

The Civil Debt (Procedures) Act 2015 provides for 2 new ways of enforcing civil debt (including unpaid water charges) – attachment of earnings and deduction from social welfare payments, as appropriate

Déanann an tAcht um Fhiachas Sibhialta (Nósanna Imeachta), 2015 foráil le haghaidh 2 bhealach nua chun fiachas sibhialta a fhorfheidhmiú (muirir uisce nach bhfuil íoctha san áireamh) – astú tuillimh agus asbhaint ó íocaíochtaí leasa shóisialaigh, de réir mar is cuí
These provisions of the Act (not yet in effect) will apply to debts of over €500 and under €4,000
Bainfidh forálacha seo an Achta (nach bhfuil i bhfeidhm fós) le fiachais atá níos mó ná €500 agus faoi bhun €4,000
Section 48 of the Environment (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2015 obliges the owner of a dwelling to pay any unpaid water charges owing to Irish Water when the property is being sold
Cuireann Alt 48 den Acht Comhshaoil (Forálacha Ilghnéitheacha), 2015 de dhualgas ar úinéir áit chónaithe muirir uisce ar bith atá dlite d’Uisce Éireann a íoc agus an réadmhaoin á díol
It also provides that social housing tenants cannot buy their homes under a tenant purchase scheme unless their water charges have been paid
Déanann sé foráil freisin nach féidir le tionóntaí tithíochta sóisialta a gcuid tithe a cheannach faoi scéim cheannaigh ag tionóntaí mura bhfuil a muirir uisce íoctha
Irish Water’s Domestic Complaint Handling Code of Practice (pdf) outlines how you can make a complaint if you are not satisfied with any of its services or any contacts you have had with it

Tugtar cuntas i gCód Cleachtais um Láimhseáil Gearáin Teaghlaigh (pdf) Uisce Éireann ar conas is féidir leat gearán a dhéanamh mura bhfuil tú sásta le haon chinn dá seirbhísí nó aon teagmháil a rinne tú leo
Its Domestic Customer Charter (pdf) provides a series of guarantees on how it will deal with customer issues
Soláthraítear ina gCairt Chustaiméirí (pdf) sraith ráthaíochtaí ar conas a dhéileálfaidh siad le saincheisteanna custaiméirí
The Commission for Energy Regulation (CER) is the economic regulator of Irish Water
Is é an Coimisiún um Rialáil Fuinnimh (CRF) rialtóir eacnamaioch Uisce Éireann
The CER does not handle complaints about water quality
Ní láimhseálann an CRF gearáin faoi cháilíocht uisce, áfach
If you have a complaint about water quality that has not been resolved by Irish Water, you should refer it to the Environmental Protection Agency, which is the environmental regulator of Irish Water
Má tá gearán agat faoi cháilíocht uisce nár réitigh Uisce Éireann, ba cheart duit an gearán a dhéanamh leis an nGníomhaireacht um Chaomhnú Comhshaoil, arb iad rialtóir comhshaoil Uisce Éireann
Section 8 of the Water Services Act 2014 provides for the CER to operate a statutory dispute resolution service to handle unresolved complaints from customers of Irish Water
Foráiltear in Alt 8 den Acht um Sheirbhísí Uisce, 2014 go n-oibreodh an CRF seirbhís réitigh díospóidí reachtúil chun gearáin neamhréitithe a láimhseáil ó chustaiméirí Uisce Éireann
If you wish to use this service, you must:
Más mian leat an tseirbhís seo a úsáid, ní mór:
• Have been a registered Irish Water customer at the time to which the complaint relates
• Go raibh tú cláraithe mar chustaiméir de cuid Uisce Éireann ag an tráth lena mbaineann an gearán
• Have already made your complaint to Irish Water in writing
• Go ndearna tú do ghearán le hUisce Éireann cheana féin i scríbhinn
• Have completed Irish Water's complaints process and received a final decision in writing
• Gur chríochnaigh tú próiseas gearán Uisce Éireann agus go bhfuair tú cinneadh deiridh i scríbhinn
The CER will issue its decision on the complaint to Irish Water
Eiseoidh an CRF a gcinneadh ar an ngearán le hUisce Éireann
It can require Irish Water to pay a refund or compensation
Féadfaidh siad iarraidh ar Uisce Éireann aisíocaíocht nó cúiteamh a íoc
It may also require Irish Water to comply with its decision in respect of other customers affected by the same issue
Ina theannta sin, féadfaidh siad a cheangal ar Uisce Éireann an cinneadh a rinne siad maidir le custaiméirí eile a ndearna an tsaincheist chéanna difear dóibh a chomhlíonadh
If you have a meter, your bill is either based on your metered usage or fixed at a capped level, whichever is lower
Má tá méadar agat, bunaítear do bhille ar d’úsáid mhéadraithe nó socraítear do bhille ar leibhéal teoranta, pé ceann is ísle
See below for details of metered and capped rates
Féach thíos chun teacht ar shonraí faoi rátaí méadraithe agus teoranta
There is no charge for children aged under 18 – their usage is covered by a free allowance
Níl aon mhuirear ar leanaí faoi bhun aois 18 mbliana – cumhdaítear a n-úsáid ag an liúntas saor in aisce
The minimum charge for unoccupied dwellings is €62.50 per service per year – a total of €125 for a house using both public water supply and public wastewater services

This charge is capped at €260 per year for a house using both services, and €130 for houses using a single service

If you only have one water service, the late payment fee is halved
Mura bhfuil ach seirbhís uisce amháin agat, gearrtar an táille ar íocaíocht dhéanach ina leath

A customer consultative forum, the Public Water Forum, has been established under Section 7 of the Water Services Act 2014

Its membership includes domestic consumers of water as well as representatives of sectoral organisations

Section 2 of the Water Services Act 2014 provides that, before a Bill can be proposed for the sale of any share in Irish Water to anyone other than a Government Minister, a number of steps must be taken:
Foráiltear in Alt 2 den Acht um Sheirbhísí Uisce, 2014, sular féidir Bille a bheartú chun aon chion in Uisce Éireann a dhíol le haon duine seachas le hAire Rialtais, ní mór tabhairt faoi líon beart:
• A resolution must be passed by each House of the Oireachtas (the Dáil and the Seanad) approving such a proposal
• Ní mór do gach Teach den Oireachtas (an Dáil agus an Seanad) rún a rith a fhaomhann an togra sin
• A proposal to allow for such a sale must be submitted to a plebiscite and
• Ní mór togra a cheadaíonn an díol sin a chur faoi phobalbhreith, agus
• The proposal must be approved in the plebiscite
• Ní mór an togra a fhaomhadh sa phobalbhreith
Anyone with a right to vote in a referendum would have the right to vote in this plebiscite
Bheadh an ceart ag aon duine a bhfuil an ceart acu chun vóta a chaitheamh i reifreann an ceart chun vóta a chaitheamh sa phobalbhreith seo
